message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.CY. 

The paper deals with the issue of detecting hoaxes and misinformation on social network sites, which is a topic that falls under the intersection of several CS sub-disciplines. The most likely category is cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), as the paper focuses on analyzing the diffusion patterns of information on social networks. The second likely category is cs.SOC (Computational Social Science), as the paper deals with social phenomena and their computational modeling. The third likely category is cs.IR (Information Retrieval), as the paper involves the classification of text data. The fourth likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), as the paper involves natural language processing techniques. The fifth likely category is cs.CY (Computers and Society), as the paper deals with the societal impact of information dissemination on social networks.
